How to Install mailutils-mh on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • mailutils-mh

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install mailutils-mh on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing mailutils-mh on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall mailutils-mh in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install mailutils-mh, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install mailutils-mh Using apt

To install mailutils-mh in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install mailutils-mh using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install mailutils-mh

The installation of mailutils-mh might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install mailutils-mh Using apt-get

To install mailutils-mh using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install mailutils-mh.

sudo apt-get -y install mailutils-mh

Install mailutils-mh Using Synaptic

To install mailutils-mh using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install mailutils-mh on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for mailutils-mh. This will display the mailutils-mh package in the package window, now to install mailutils-mh, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the mailutils-mh package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of mailutils-mh.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install mailutils-mh Using aptitude

To install mailutils-mh on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of mailutils-mh.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install mailutils-mh using the command aptitude install mailutils-mh.

sudo aptitude -y install mailutils-mh

How to Upgrade mailutils-mh on debian

If you want to upgrade the mailutils-mh package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade mailutils-mh using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade mailutils-mh to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade mailutils-mh.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade mailutils-mh sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade mailutils-mh

Upgrade mailutils-mh using Aptitude

To upgrade mailutils-mh using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade mailutils-mh.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade mailutils-mh

Upgrade mailutils-mh using Synaptic

To upgrade mailutils-mh using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for mailutils-mh, now right-click mailutils-mh, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade mailutils-mh just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall mailutils-mh on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall mailutils-mh from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just mailutils-mh, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove mailutils-mh

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of mailutils-mh

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of mailutils-mh you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge mailutils-mh

Remove mailutils-mh using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall mailutils-mh using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for mailutils-mh, right-click the mailutils-mh package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall mailutils-mh click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install mailutils-mh on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade mailutils-mh using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of mailutils-mh then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
